verses.verse: But there will be no <S%H3808><s%> [more] gloom <S%H4155><s%> for her who <S%H834><s%> was in anguish; <S%H4164><s%> in earlier <S%H7223><s%> times <S%H6256><s%> He treated <S%H7043><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Zebulun <S%H2074><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> of Naphtali <S%H5321><s%> with contempt, <S%H7043><s%> but later <S%H314><s%> on He shall make <S%H3513><s%> [it] glorious, <S%H3513><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> on the other <S%H5676><s%> side <S%H5676><s%> of Jordan, <S%H3383><s%> Galilee <S%H1551><s%> of the Gentiles. <S%H1471><s%>

The people <S%H5971><s%> who walk <S%H1980><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%> Will see <S%H7200><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> light; <S%H216><s%> Those who live <S%H3427><s%> in a dark <S%H6757><s%> land, <S%H776><s%> The light <S%H216><s%> will shine <S%H5050><s%> on them.

Thou shalt multiply <S%H7235><s%> the nation, <S%H1471><s%> Thou shalt increase <S%H1431><s%> their gladness; <S%H8057><s%> They will be glad <S%H8055><s%> in Thy presence <S%H6440><s%> As with the gladness <S%H8057><s%> of harvest, <S%H7105><s%> As men rejoice <S%H1523><s%> when they divide <S%H2505><s%> the spoil. <S%H7998><s%>

For Thou shalt break <S%H2865><s%> the yoke <S%H5923><s%> of their burden <S%H5448><s%> and the staff <S%H4294><s%> on their shoulders, <S%H7926><s%> The rod <S%H7626><s%> of their oppressor, <S%H5065><s%> as at the battle <S%H3117><s%> of Midian. <S%H4080><s%>

For every <S%H3605><s%> boot <S%H5430><s%> of the booted <S%H5431><s%> warrior <S%H5431><s%> in the [battle] tumult, <S%H7494><s%> And cloak <S%H8071><s%> rolled <S%H1556><s%> in blood, <S%H1818><s%> will be for burning, <S%H8316><s%> fuel <S%H3980><s%> for the fire. <S%H784><s%>

For a child <S%H3206><s%> will be born <S%H3205><s%> to us, a son <S%H1121><s%> will be given <S%H5414><s%> to us; And the government <S%H4951><s%> will rest <S%H1961><s%> on His shoulders; <S%H7926><s%> And His name <S%H8034><s%> will be called <S%H7121><s%> Wonderful <S%H6382><s%> Counselor, <S%H3289><s%> Mighty <S%H1368><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> Eternal <S%H5703><s%> Father, Prince <S%H1><s%> of Peace. <S%H8269><s%>

There <S%H369><s%> will be no <S%H369><s%> end <S%H7093><s%> to the increase <S%H4766><s%> of [His] government <S%H4951><s%> or of peace, <S%H7965><s%> On the throne <S%H3678><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> and over <S%H5921><s%> his kingdom, <S%H4467><s%> To establish <S%H3559><s%> it and to uphold <S%H5582><s%> it with justice <S%H4941><s%> and righteousness <S%H6666><s%> From then <S%H6258><s%> on and forevermore. <S%H5703><s%> <S%H5769><s%> The zeal <S%H7068><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> will accomplish <S%H6213><s%> this. <S%H384><s%>
The Lord <S%H136><s%> sends <S%H7971><s%> a message <S%H1697><s%> against Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> And it falls <S%H5307><s%> on Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

And all <S%H3605><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> [it,] [That is,] Ephraim <S%H669><s%> and the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Samaria, <S%H8111><s%> Asserting <S%H559><s%> in pride <S%H1346><s%> and in arrogance <S%H1433><s%> of heart: <S%H3824><s%>

"The bricks <S%H3843><s%> have fallen <S%H5307><s%> down, <S%H5307><s%> But we will rebuild <S%H1129><s%> with smooth <S%H1496><s%> stones; <S%H1496><s%> The sycamores <S%H8256><s%> have been cut <S%H1438><s%> down, <S%H1438><s%> But we will replace <S%H2498><s%> [them] with cedars. <S%H730><s%>"
Therefore the Lord <S%H3068><s%> raises <S%H7682><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them adversaries <S%H6862><s%> from Rezin, <S%H7526><s%> And spurs <S%H5526><s%> their enemies <S%H340><s%> on,

The Arameans <S%H758><s%> on the east <S%H6924><s%> and the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> on the west; <S%H268><s%> And they devour <S%H398><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> with gaping <S%H3605><s%> jaws. <S%H6310><s%> In [spite of] all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H384><s%> His anger <S%H639><s%> does not turn <S%H7725><s%> away, <S%H7725><s%> And His hand <S%H3027><s%> is still <S%H5750><s%> stretched <S%H5186><s%> out.

Yet the people <S%H5971><s%> do not turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> to Him who struck <S%H5221><s%> them, Nor <S%H3808><s%> do they seek <S%H1875><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts. <S%H6635><s%>

So the Lord <S%H3068><s%> cuts <S%H3772><s%> off <S%H3772><s%> head <S%H7218><s%> and tail <S%H2180><s%> from Israel, <S%H3478><s%> [Both] palm <S%H3712><s%> branch <S%H3712><s%> and bulrush <S%H100><s%> in a single <S%H259><s%> day. <S%H3117><s%>

The head <S%H7218><s%> is the elder <S%H2205><s%> and honorable <S%H6440><s%> <S%H5375><s%> man, And the prophet <S%H5030><s%> who teaches <S%H3384><s%> falsehood <S%H8267><s%> is the tail. <S%H2180><s%>

For those who guide <S%H833><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> are leading <S%H8582><s%> [them] astray; <S%H8582><s%> And those who are guided <S%H833><s%> by them are brought <S%H1104><s%> to confusion. <S%H1104><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> does not take <S%H8055><s%> pleasure <S%H8055><s%> in their young <S%H970><s%> men, <S%H970><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> does He have <S%H7355><s%> pity <S%H7355><s%> on their orphans <S%H3490><s%> or their widows; <S%H490><s%> For every <S%H3605><s%> one <S%H3605><s%> of them is godless <S%H2611><s%> and an evildoer, <S%H7489><s%> And every <S%H3605><s%> mouth <S%H6310><s%> is speaking <S%H1696><s%> foolishness. <S%H5039><s%> In [spite of] all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H384><s%> His anger <S%H639><s%> does not turn <S%H7725><s%> away, <S%H7725><s%> And His hand <S%H3027><s%> is still <S%H5750><s%> stretched <S%H5186><s%> out.

For wickedness <S%H7564><s%> burns <S%H1197><s%> like a fire; <S%H784><s%> It consumes <S%H398><s%> briars <S%H8068><s%> and thorns; <S%H7898><s%> It even sets <S%H3341><s%> the thickets <S%H5442><s%> of the forest <S%H9194><s%> aflame, <S%H3341><s%> And they roll <S%H55><s%> upward <S%H55><s%> in a column <S%H1348><s%> of smoke. <S%H6227><s%>

By the fury <S%H5678><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> is burned <S%H6272><s%> up, And the people <S%H5971><s%> are like fuel <S%H3980><s%> for the fire; <S%H784><s%> No <S%H3808><s%> man <S%H376><s%> spares <S%H2550><s%> his brother. <S%H251><s%>

And they slice <S%H1504><s%> off <S%H1504><s%> [what is] on the right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> but [still] are hungry, <S%H7456><s%> And they eat <S%H398><s%> [what is] on the left <S%H8040><s%> hand <S%H8040><s%> but they are not satisfied; <S%H7646><s%> Each <S%H376><s%> of them eats <S%H398><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> of his own arm. <S%H2220><s%>

Manasseh <S%H4519><s%> [devours] Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> and Ephraim <S%H669><s%> Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> [And] together <S%H9191><s%> they are against <S%H5921><s%> Judah. <S%H3063><s%> In [spite of] all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H384><s%> His anger <S%H639><s%> does not turn <S%H7725><s%> away, <S%H7725><s%> And His hand <S%H3027><s%> is still <S%H5750><s%> stretched <S%H5186><s%> out.
